definition[0]: to touch something or make changes to it without permission, especially in order to deliberately damage it
example[0]: He noticed that the instruments had been tampered with.
example[1]: I don’t see the point in tampering with a system that’s worked fine so far.
example[2]: Some of the packs may have been tampered with.
example[3]: The government does not want to tamper with an economy that is already healing itself.
